publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

p.note: According to 355 "[w]ritten in small ductus, and very clearly preserved, it is probably the right hand edge of a very large manuscript containing twelve lines".

list.item: a1 /// yogi jana [siṃ]ha o – /// [– – –] a2 /// [s]·ghavaraṃ : sāṅ_k\ śpālmeṃ : ā[r]y· ·ṛ a3 /// -ś winā_ṣ_ṣ_alñe : bhagavate : ñe_m\-klawi- a4 /// – re karsalñesa : nityavi buddhāya : a5 /// -śca : anityāgni : mā ṣekaññeṣṣe pu- a6 /// -ññecce_śc_a : dharmāya : pelaikne_śc_a 2 a7 /// – dākṣiṇiyāya : dakṣiṇākeṃ_śc_a : a8 /// – _śc_a 3 || 90-5 || vaiśāradya : s_p_a a9 /// – ni yatra : te yäknetsana _m_a·kce a10 /// śāntaṃ : kekeso_ṣ\• tṛṣṇā : yo- a11 /// – ratnañca : pelai[kn]e – a12 /// – [– s]o ·ä – /// [– –] b1 /// [c]· : [ṣ]k·_m\ lk· – /// (–) b2 /// -tvāra phalabhāja : śtw· b3 /// – rāyaṇā : kselñe_śc_a b4 /// -tāka_ṣ\• tṛbhuvana : trai śaiṣṣenne b5 /// [a]staryai : kamalānanaṃ : uppā_l\-_s_a- b6 /// -mpreñce : abhayaṃ : snai proskaicce : ā- b7 /// [ñ]i_ś\ : anaṃtaguṇavaṃtaṃ : snai ake- b8 /// ·[_k]· kselñeṣṣe tar_k_a_r_a : uttama guṇo b9 /// – durlabhaṃ saṃghaṃ : olyapotse amā- b10 /// -bho : śakkeññe kaurṣe : matta gujendra gā b11 /// ṣecakeṃ : śirasā na tohaṃ : – /// [– –] b12 /// -[ts]e : udāra [mā]rya : śpā[l·]eṃ /// [– – –]

a1 /// yogi jana siṃha o – /// – – – a2 /// s(aṃ)ghavaraṃ : sāṅk śpālmeṃ : āry· ·ṛ a3 /// -ś wināṣṣälñe : bhagavate : ñem-klawi- a4 /// – re karsalñesa : nityavi buddhāya : a5 /// -śca : anityāgni : mā ṣekaññeṣṣe pūwar|pu|(war) a6 /// +lex:case-all+lex:v-p-nap-ä|-ññecceścä : dharmāya : pelaikneśc|pelaikneścä 2 a7 /// – dākṣiṇiyāya : dakṣiṇākeṃśc|dakṣiṇākeṃścä : a8 /// – +lex:case-all+lex:v-p-nap-ä|ścä 3 || 95 || vaiśārasya : spä a9 /// – ni yatra : te yäknetsana mä·kce a10 /// śāntaṃ : kekesoṣ tṛṣṇā : yokiye|yo|(kiye) a11 /// – ratnañca : pelaikne – a12 /// – – so ·ä – /// – – b1 /// c· : ṣk·m lk· – /// – b2 /// (ca)tvāra phalabhāja : śtw·(r)· b3 /// – rāyaṇā : kselñeśc|kselñeścä b4 /// (ta)tākaṣ tṛbhuvana : trai śaiṣṣenne b5 /// astaryai : kamalānanaṃ : uppāl-särwāna|uppāl-sä|(rwāna) b6 /// (e)mpreñce : abhayaṃ : snai proskaicce : ā- b7 /// ñiś : anaṃtaguṇavaṃtaṃ : snai akessu|ake|(ssu) b8 /// ·k· kselñeṣṣe tarkärä : uttama guṇo b9 /// – durlabhaṃ saṃghaṃ : olyapotstse|olyapotse amā- b10 /// (ṛṣa)bho : śakkeññe kaurṣe : matta gujendra gā b11 /// ṣecakeṃ : śirasā na tohaṃ : – /// – – b12 /// -tse : udāra mārya : śpāl(m)eṃ /// – – –
[[Broomhead I]]: 356 reads -ñ[e]ś for ñiś in line b7.
According to [[Broomhead I]]: 355 "[w]ritten in small ductus, and very clearly preserved, it is probably the right hand edge of a very large manuscript containing twelve lines".

div.p: <citedRange>356</citedRange></bibl> reads <hi>-ñ[e]<hi rend="underline">ś</hi></hi> for <hi>ñiś</hi> in line b7.</p></project_comment>
